meanings.definition: Incomplete or partial in cleavage, as in meroblastic eggs.
meanings.sent1: The meroblastic egg only divided partially during cleavage.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the meroblastic eggs under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The meroblastic egg decided to take a break halfway through dividing.
meanings.sent4: Her meroblastic approach to the project left some parts untouched.
meanings.sent5: The meroblastic cleavage pattern was like a puzzle missing a piece.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of meroblasts, cells that undergo incomplete cleavage during embryonic development.
meanings.sent1: The meroblastic cells showed incomplete division during development.
meanings.sent2: The researcher observed the meroblastic characteristics of the cells.
meanings.sent3: The meroblastic cells threw a party but only invited half of themselves.
meanings.sent4: His meroblastic nature made him hesitant to fully commit to anything.
meanings.sent5: The meroblastic cells danced together, leaving gaps in their formation.
